overview_of_class: This class will introduce students to the basics of animation and effects using JavaScript. - manipulating HTML elements on the page, we focus on movement and timing, and then combining effects to build custom animations that users can interact with by using the mouse or gestures. Students will use these skills to storyboard and then build interactive stories to publish online using JavaScript. Prerequisite: Interactive Storytelling with JavaScript.

overview_of_class: JavaScript is the world's most popular programming language. It is the language for HTML and all modern browsers. It gives journalists the power to add interactivity, build applications, and retrieve data, among other uses. This course introduces students to JavaScript coding with an eye toward narrative. Students will learn the basics of interactive storytelling through an in-depth study of nonlinear narrative structure in the media today, while learning to build their own stories during hands-on web-development labs. Knowledge of HTML and CSS is required.
name: Special Topics
subject: JOUR

overview_of_class: This course offers an introduction to visual communication principles, aesthetics, research and applications in the field. The course will examine methods for effective communication using images and design as a language. It prepares students for further study in photojournalism, video storytelling, publication design and interactive storytelling. The class will follow the narrative arc of visual storytelling from the ancient 32,000 year old Chauvet Cave paintings in southern France all the way to the sophisticated eye track activity recognition systems that influence modern design. Students will learn and apply Gestalt theory to design problems and expand their visual lexicon. Photo history will be brought into context with the larger visual narrative and explore how light, shape, form and composition help communicate complex thought and emotion. Guest lecturers will frequent the class giving insight into how visual language is used to communicate and report beyond words.
name: Special Topics
